qas.question: What professor began working on solid-fuel rockets since 1914?
Liquid-fueled rockets were developed in what year?

context: The American professor <a0_0>Robert H. Goddard<a0_0/> had worked on developing solid-fuel rockets since 1914, and demonstrated a light battlefield rocket to the US Army Signal Corps only five days before the signing of the armistice that ended World War I. He also started developing liquid-fueled rockets in <a1_0>1921<a1_0/>; yet he had not been taken seriously by the public, and was not sponsored by the government as part of the post-WW II rocket development effort. Von Braun, himself inspired by Goddard's work, was bemused by this when debriefed by his American handlers, asking them, "Why didn't you just ask Dr. Goddard?"[citation needed]
